file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 24-35-01-04 - BACKUP BATTERY - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL BACKUP BATTERY - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the backup battery. B. The backup battery is installed on the right side of fuselage forward section I. C. You can get access to the backup battery through access panel 114BZ in the nose-landing-gear compartment. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 24-35-01-000-801-A BACKUP BATTERY - REMOVAL ALL 24-35-01-400-801-A BACKUP BATTERY - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 24-35-01 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 24-35-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. BACKUP BATTERY - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the backup battery. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM SDS 24-35-00/1 HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200 LG SAFETY PIN - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL S.B.145-32-0036 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 114 114BZ RH Forward fuselage section I D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task RH Forward fuselage section I I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the nose landing-gear-safety pin ( AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/ 200) is installed. (2) On aircraft PRE-MOD S.B.145-32-0036, make sure that the pressure in hydraulic system 1 is fully released ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 24-35-01 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) On aircraft POST-MOD S.B.145-32-0036, install the safety pin of the NLG door solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). (4) Make sure that the GPU pushbutton, on the electrical panel, on the overhead panel, is set at OFF (The striped bar is off). (5) Attach a DO-NOT-SET-ON tag to the GPU pushbutton. (6) Make sure that the BATT 1 and BATT 2 switches, on the electrical panel, on the overhead panel, are set at OFF. (7) Attach a DO-NOT-SET-AUTO tag to the BATT 1 and BATT 2 switches. (8) Set the backup pushbutton, on the electrical panel, on the overhead panel, to OFF (AMM SDS 24-35-00/1). (9) Attach a DO-NOT-SET-AUTO tag to the backup pushbutton. (10) Open access panel 114BZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Loosen the self-locking retainer (1) from the backup battery (2). (2) Remove the backup battery (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 24-35-01 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

OVER 55 C CELL TEST AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Backup Battery - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE 214 B DET. A 2. BACK-UP BATTERY DET. B 1. SELF-LOCKING RETAINER 145AMM240014.MCE B EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 24-35-01 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 24-35-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. BACKUP BATTERY - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the backup battery. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM SDS 24-35-00/1 AMM TASK 24-35-00-700-801-A/500 BACK-UP BATTERY SYSTEM - OPERATIONAL TEST SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL S.B.145-32-0036 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 114 114BZ RH Forward fuselage section I D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task RH Forward fuselage section I I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A NOTE: Before installation of the backup battery, be sure to remove the protective ESD connector cover in the back face of the battery, if applicable. (1) Put the backup battery (2) in the aircraft. (2) Tighten the self-locking retainer (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 24-35-01 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Follow-on SUBTASK 410-002-A (1) Install the 114BZ access panel (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (2) Remove the DO-NOT-SET-ON tag from the GPU pushbutton. (3) Remove the DO-NOT-SET-AUTO tag from the BATT 1 and BATT 2 switches. (4) Remove the DO-NOT-SET-AUTO tag from the backup pushbutton. (5) Set the backup pushbutton to AUTO (AMM SDS 24-35-00/1). (6) Do the operational test of the backup battery system ( AMM TASK 24-35-00-700-801- A/500). (7) On aircraft POST-MOD S.B.145-32-0036, remove the safety pin of the NLG door solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 24-35-01 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
